commitmsg: Add tips on how to configure auditd for prod servers
Remove evil additional tabs for readability

Change dep for debian from libaudit0 to auditd:
since diff deb-based distros use libaudit0 or libaudit1 it makes it
easier to install (single package for all) even thus technically, this
plugin really depends on libaudit
Bump version to 1.3

fix leak with attributes, always make sure the list if deleted
use alloca where applicable for niceness ;-)
Bump version
Fix *erm* memleak in get_username
add fpm version support (starting at 1.1)

set duser and duid for the original user, easier to figure out on the
as-manager side
Only make on modified file ;-)

Fix spacing issue when strings are cut
"Fix" horrible string len calculation
ensure uid gets written in the msg (not overwritten by suid)

Fix bug in handling getpwuid_r
it does not set the pwd struct to null when no match is found
fixes for rpm/deb build
Correct debian dependencies
Support automatic build for RPM, DEB via FPM
Initial commit - ported from github.com/gdestuynder/audit-cef
Re-introduce ppid (parent process id) in order to be able to recreate the exact process tree from logs
Bump 2.1.0
manage queue list size (drop when max reached) and check queue every audispd=>audisp-json read
Send debug logs to the debug facility, not info ;-)
Replace ring function by linked-list to avoid unnecessary msg loss (different trade-off)
Add phony for clean target
Change some fixed-len to dynamic or #defined len for clarity

While msg can never be bigger  than MAX_AUDIT_MESSAGE_LEN (8970) due to the code flow - reusing the MAX_JSON_MSG_SIZE
(4096) for message arguments is not exacly nice neither it is accurate. (and could be security relevant if the code change).
Ensuring whole message is always smaller than MAX_JSON_MSG_SIZE instead.
Fix size of cmp len checks. Works otherwise but not very nice.
More error checking (https://github.com/gdestuynder/audisp-json/pull/5/files)
Warn on message lost if the ring buffer is overflown

Bugfix: while we support keep-alive, lets not yell about it if it works (100-continue) or for any other informational
HTTP message for that matter (we still care about non-200 success msgs)

Fix reorder_hack to be enabl-able on the cli,
Bugfix/typo properly reset start ;)

Bump to version 2.0.0 to avoid versionning confusing (1.9 > 1.14)
Some more documentation in the readme
bump 1.14

Change processing logic for efficiency and compat
- Re-enter select() loop as often as necessary
- No longer run a certain amount of times, this does not work the same way with all versions of libcurl
- Bugfix uninitialized returned value from get_username (doh...)
- Correct ring buffer handling not to overflow the buffer (doh...)
- A little bit of tidying
Version bump 1.13

Always consume all msgs when program end even if ring buffer is empty (bugfix)
Only give curl one chance to set a timeout (2 perform runs) - this may be tweaked further to statically define the
timeout instead of limiting attempts in the future
Bump 1.12

Support for max_curl_runs - ensure we exit the select/perform loop sufficiently quickly without affecting CURL global
timeout (of 5s)
If messages are still in the queue, the last perform cleanup will attempt to send them all.
Code cleanups, -Wall debug support
Bump to 1.11
Allow to force program termination on double keyboard interrupt (nicer to the user/debugger)

Handle sig_int, properly call handlers
Handlers values wouldn't be actually handled as it was since you'd have to wait for fgets loops to complete/fail. Now calling handlers
within the loop.
Fix conflicting scope of signal variables
Add support for config.curl_filelog - a file path to write curl errors (default is stderr which is hard to capture)
Don't default to debug 0, default to no debug so that user can set it on the CLI.
bump version 1.10
Add support for logging adjtime as JSON msg, fixes issue https://github.com/gdestuynder/audisp-json/issues/3
Bump to version 1.9
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:gdestuynder/audisp-json

Change MAX_ATTR_SIZE to MAX_AUDIT_MESSAGE_LENGTH

While not exactly accurate and bigger than needed, this ensure there is always enough space under normal operating
conditions (calculating attr size is hard because it depends on all other attributes in the string)

Alternative would be to chop the string first,then add quoting, which is nicer, but also slower.

Merge pull request #2 from bhourigan/master

Updating README.rst to be consistent with build instructions outlined in...
Updating README.rst to be consistent with build instructions outlined in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1112233
Bump version 1.8
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:gdestuynder/audisp-json
Ported config load fix from https://github.com/gdestuynder/audisp-cef/commit/2acd2bb21a50a99adbefb0b527033dd71bf496da

Update README.rst

Cleanup old doc

Update README.rst

Update config examples to match how audisp-json works.
Check if we need to re-call curl_multi_perform immediately (curl 7.2+)
Bump version 1.7

Fix matching (null) string.

I don't even know how this happened. Uff.
Support for ANOM_PROMISCUOUS (interface going in/out of promicuous mode) message type
Update doc on message format to correspond to the code.

Support passing options to fpm via FPMOPTS

e.g: make rpm FPMOPTS="--replaces audisp-cef"

Ignore execve syscalls with no EXECVE message, v1.6

Also fixes a comment typo
Also enhance the reordering hack to attempt to output single messages
Also disables reordering by default
and finally, enable ignoring these execve syscalls with no EXECVE message by default.

See source code for more information on why this is done.

compilation:
make REORDER_HACK=1 (for the reorder hack..)
make IGNORE_EMPTY_EXECVE_COMMAND=0 (to disable empty execves, you'll have an empty summary field in the json message for
these)

Added buffering to REORDER_HACK and various string, alloc, etc checks
Also fixed reorder logic and a few comments
use mirror ring buffer
clarify a bit attribute management
dont shorten values ;)

support DEBUG=1 (symbols) and DEBUG=2 (symbols + json output)
fix REORDER_HACK so that you can actually turn it off ;)

Added REORDER_HACK hack. Removed unused strstok function.
REORDER_HACK reorder the messages so that they come in sequential order.
This allows libaudit to properly correlate the event id and create a complete event.
Without the hack, the event would have empty attributes/fields.

Note that when this is fixed in libaudit the hack should be disabled as it's neither nice, neither fast.
You can disable it at compile time with `make REORDER_HACK=0'
fix debian package dependency names for libcurl

Change curl processing logic - avoids null posts

This ensures that curl only process handles that exist. There was a wrong assumption that curl_nr_h was keeping a
consistent state, including when it's passed to curl. It's in fact only returning the current state.
Note that I don't think this specified, hence the confusion.
Indent fix
Copy postfields in curl, don't race on free.

Also remove keys and values if message == "(null)"
i.e. if the conversion to string has already happened and the string is not NULL anymore (but a string that says so)
Actually fixes issue 1 :)
Fixes issue 1: do not add fields when value is NULL
documentation for curl_cainfo option

Support for setting cainfo (ie a particular ca to trust)
Some cleanup
separate libcurl and http code error in case libcurl fails first

added all invalid json string cases from
https://bitbucket.org/zserge/jsmn/

unescape json summary
unescape also now removes LF and CR as that's not valid JSON

Reorganize setting category/summary so that we can always pick what we want as summary regardless of the order of
messages
Set details.summary in AUDIT_EXECVE so that the summary is able to reflect the full command
Support more write-like and chown-like syscalls

Ensure PROGRAM_VERSION is always str
Typo fix for PROGRAM_NAME definition
Don't quote the version or itll be quoted in the USER_AGENT

Throw error in syslog if mozdef returns an error code

If HTTP response from MozDef is non-200 - OK, inform us via syslog.
auid is already translated to a more-human value in JSON: originaluid
Use processname as logger processname and details.processname as audited program's process name
More details about the message format.
Get process name from "comm" when available

Comments++
Add lookup for processname (from pid) to get the userland-view of process names in case its != comm field.

Make summary customizable, add DEBUG option

make DEBUG=1 to see JSON messages on stdout
json_msg.summary is now on the heap so we can add some attributes to it instead of a dumb message only.

Use fread_unlocked for speed.
Prettify some parts of the code.
Set the havejson match on the SYSCALL record type only, we don't want partial records with EXECVE.
Added comment that explains why this may happen - this can be fixed by libaudit or the kernel.
only send json for execve when we have the complete msg
cleanups
free msg since its copied in libcurl
Enforce types

Support for SSP and FORTIFY_SOURCE by default

Correct errors related to FORTIFY_SOURCE checks.
Drop and re-add handle during curl multi cleanup.
Always allocate the json attribute so that it gets deallocated properly (as we use the "(null)" translation for NULL
strings anyway.
death to spaces
indent
modeline (vim)
configuration file details

Implement sending of messages via libcurl

Uses a ring buffer (msg_list) to fill in messages at a max of 512 messages currently.
Then uses select to run curl_multi functions.

create json message
convert all CEF attrs to json details
remove extra_record and associated code as its no longer necessary (the
json msg can have any number of attributes)
Set program version at compile time

json conversion cleanups
mozdef_url configuration
Modifying json msg format
Quick conversion to json - doesn't actually work or anything
added documentation on message format
Details on msg handling and build deps
match program name in log
Version bump 1.4

Handle error if gethostbyname fails

handling gethostname() isn't enough

Lookup hostname using gethostbyname instead of uts

Using uts doesn't work if the host has only a nodename, which is often the case on misconfigured systems.
gethostbyname will consolidate the nodename and whatever domainname by using a socket and NIS/YP/NSCD instead of uts ("uname").

Also fixed an indent issue.

Update README.rst

fix the syslog-ng example
convert to rst, add syslog-ng examples
